intro: Lysimachia tengyuehensis, commonly known as the Yunnan chickweed, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. It has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces yellow or white flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
